page.title: 14 Winsford Flashes
page.content: {Winsford Flashes}were created by subsidence.This took place when salt had been removed by mining and this caused the land to sink.There are two main types of{subsidence.}The first being known as{linear}the second known as{crater.}The subsidence at the flashes is crater.The flashes were filled with water from the{River {Weaver}which runs past the{Meadowbank {Rock Salt Mine.} One of the worst hit areas for reckless pumping was{Northwich}which suffered much damage to its buildings. This should never happen again as pumping is now controlled.
